column2: In these situations you expect your friend to agree with you. Put the words in order.
column3:
You and a friend are outside a restaurant. You're looking at the prices, which are very high.
You say:

It's {{c1::very}} {{c1::expensive}} {{c1::,}} {{c1::isn't}} {{c1::it}} (isn't / expensive / , / it / very)?

column2: In these situations you expect your friend to agree with you. Put the words in order.
column3:
You and a colleague have just finished a training course. You really enjoyed it.
You say:

The {{c1::course}} {{c1::was}} {{c1::great}} {{c1::,}} {{c1::wasn't}} {{c1::it}} (great / it / wasn't / , / course / was)?

column2: In these situations you expect your friend to agree with you. Put the words in order.
column3:
You're listening to a woman singing. She's very good.
You say to your friend:

She's {{c1::got}} {{c1::a}} {{c1::lovely}} {{c1::voice}} {{c1::,}} {{c1::hasn't}} {{c1::she}} (hasn't / a / voice / she / , / got / lovely)?

column2: In these situations you expect your friend to agree with you. Put the words in order.
column3:
You're trying on a jacket in a shop.
You look in the mirror and you don't like what you see.
You say to your friend:

It {{c1::doesn't}} {{c1::look}} {{c1::very good}} {{c1::,}} {{c1::does}} {{c1::it}} (look / it / does / , / very good / doesn't)?

column2: In these situations you expect your friend to agree with you. Put the words in order.
column3:
Your friend's hair is much shorter than when you last met.
You say to your friend:

You've {{c1::had}} {{c1::your hair}} {{c1::cut}} {{c1::,}} {{c1::haven't}} {{c1::you}} (cut / had / you / , / haven't / your hair)?

column2: In these situations you expect your friend to agree with you. Put the words in order.
column3:
You and a friend are walking over a small wooden bridge. The bridge is old and some parts are broken.
You say:

This {{c1::bridge}} {{c1::isn't}} {{c1::very safe}} {{c1::,}} {{c1::is}} {{c1::it}} (very safe / it / is / , / isn't / bridge)?
